subject: Cybersecurity
title: Cryptocurrency and Crime: Bitcoin's Double-Edged Sword
description: A fast breakdown of Cryptocurrency and Crime: Bitcoin's Double-Edged Sword for builders.

hook.text: Bitcoin was supposed to be anonymous. In reality, every transaction is permanently recorded on a public ledger.

buildup.text: Cryptocurrency enabled dark web commerce by allowing payments without banks. Bitcoin became the currency of cybercrime.

discovery.text: But Bitcoin's blockchain is public. Every transaction is traceable. Blockchain analysis firms can follow the money.

twist.text: Criminals now prefer privacy coins like Monero, which obscure sender, receiver, and amount. Bitcoin is too.

climax.text: Bitcoin enabled cybercrime but also enabled law enforcement. The permanent ledger is both shield and weapon.

punchline.text: Every Bitcoin transaction is a permanent public receipt.

quiz.question: Why are criminals shifting from Bitcoin to privacy coins like Monero?
options: Bitcoin's blockchain is public, making transactions traceable
